Rotaâ€”Baxter operators of zero weight on simple Jordan algebra of Clifford type

V. Gubarev

Abstract

It is proved that any Rotaâ€”Baxter operator of zero weight on Jordan algebra of a nondegenerate bilinear symmetric form is nilpotent of index less or equal three. We state exact value of nilpotency index on simple Jordan algebra of Clifford type over fields â„â„\mathbb{R}, â„‚â„‚\mathbb{C}, and â„¤psubscriptâ„¤ğ‘\mathbb{Z}_{p}. For â„¤psubscriptâ„¤ğ‘\mathbb{Z}_{p}, we essentially use the results from number theory concerned quadratic residues and Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem.

Keywords: Rotaâ€”Baxter operator, Jordan algebra of Clifford type, quadratic residue, Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem.

1 Introduction

In 1933, the physicist P. Jordan introduced in quantum mechanics a notion of Jordan algebra [12]. A Jordan algebra Jğ½J over a field Fğ¹F of characteristic â‰ 2absent2\neq 2 is a commutative (nonassociative) algebra over Fğ¹F satisfying the Jordan identity (x2â€‹y)â€‹x=x2â€‹(yâ€‹x)superscriptğ‘¥2ğ‘¦ğ‘¥superscriptğ‘¥2ğ‘¦ğ‘¥(x^{2}y)x=x^{2}(yx).

Any associative algebra under the new product xâˆ˜y=12â€‹(xâ€‹y+yâ€‹x)ğ‘¥ğ‘¦12ğ‘¥ğ‘¦ğ‘¦ğ‘¥x\circ y=\frac{1}{2}(xy+yx) is a Jordan algebra. For example, a matrix algebra under âˆ˜\circ turns to be a simple Jordan algebra. Moreover, the set of self-adjoint matrices over â„â„\mathbb{R}, â„‚â„‚\mathbb{C}, or â„â„\mathbb{H} with the product âˆ˜\circ is a Jordan algebra (of Hermitian type). The set of self-adjoint matrices of order three over the octonions under âˆ˜\circ is a 27-dimensional simple Jordan algebra (of Albert type). Given a vector space Vğ‘‰V with nondegenerate bilinear symmetric form fğ‘“f, one can equip a space FâŠ•Vdirect-sumğ¹ğ‘‰F\oplus V with a structure of simple Jordan algebra provided dim(V)â‰¥2dimensionğ‘‰2\dim(V)\geq 2 (Clifford type).

The first classification theorem for Jordan algebras was obtained by P. Jordan, J. von Neumann, and E. Wigner in 1934 [13]. In 1978â€“1983, E. Zelmanov was a leader of so called Russian revolution [14] in theory of Jordan algebras. In particular, he proved that any prime (including simple) Jordan algebra without absolute zero divisors is either of Hermitian, or Albert, or Clifford type [17].

Jordan algebras are deeply connected with Lie algebras and finite simple groups (Kantorâ€”KÃ¶cherâ€”Tits construction, The Freudenthalâ€”Tits Magic Square) [11, 14].

Let us refer a reader to the excellent monographs on Jordan algebras [11, 14, 18] written by N. Jacobson, K. McKrimmon, and K.A. Zhevlakov et al.

The notions of Rotaâ€”Baxter operator and Rotaâ€”Baxter algebra were introduced by G. Baxter in 1960 [3] as a generalization of by part integration formula. Since 1960s, J.-C. Rota, P. Cartier, L. Guo, C. Bai and others studied combinatorial and algebraic properties of Rotaâ€”Baxter algebras (see details in a unique monograph on the subject written by L. Guo in 2012 [9]).

Also, the deep connection of Rotaâ€”Baxter algebras with Yangâ€”Baxter equation, quantum field theory and Loday algebras was found [4, 15, 1, 7, 2, 8].

In 1935, C. Chevalley [5] and E. Warning [16] proved two very close theorems which are now gathered in one Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem. This theorem states than over finite field any system of polynomial equations with sufficiently large number of variables has a solution. From that time, a lot of connections and applications of Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem were found such that combinatorial Nullstellensatz, ErdÃ¶sâ€”Ginzburgâ€”Ziv theorem etc. (see, e.g. [6]).

The goal of the current work is to investigate Rotaâ€”Baxter operators of zero weight on simple Jordan algebra of a nondegenerate bilinear form. At first, we prove that all such operators are nilpotent of index not greater than 3. At second, we are interested on the exact value of nilpotency index of Rotaâ€”Baxter operators of zero weight. It occurs that the nilpotency index of Rotaâ€”Baxter operators of zero weight on simple Jordan algebra of Clifford type depends on the dimension of algebra and the ground field. If the ground field is finite, we essentially use Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem and its corollaries.

We are always mentioning that characteristic of the ground field Fğ¹F is not 2.

2 Preliminaries

2.2 Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem

For our purposes, let us write down the following version of Chevalleyâ€”Warning theorem:

Then, for any a,b,câˆˆFâˆ—ğ‘ğ‘ğ‘superscriptğ¹a,b,c\in F^{*}, there exist x,yâˆˆFğ‘¥ğ‘¦ğ¹x,y\in F such that aâ€‹x2+bâ€‹y2=cğ‘superscriptğ‘¥2ğ‘superscriptğ‘¦2ğ‘ax^{2}+by^{2}=c.

Corollary 1. Let Fğ¹F be an algebraically closed or finite field, then rbâ€‹(J3)=2rbsubscriptğ½32\textrm{rb}(J_{3})=2.
